Expectation1: Provide guidance to clients regarding machine usage
Situation1: A new client casually requests basic operating tips during a routine check-in call.
Situation2: A significant community milestone is being marked, and attendees have travelled specifically to hear the imam's sermon.
Story: I glanced at the clock as I finished tightening the last bolt on the client’s machine. My phone buzzed—a new client, sounding nervous, asked if I could walk him through the basics of his equipment. He’d just started his business, and I could hear the anxiety in his voice. I knew how much a few minutes of guidance could mean to someone in his position. But as I listened, my mind kept drifting to the mosque. Today was not just any Friday; it was the anniversary of our community’s founding, and people had come from neighboring towns to hear my sermon. The board had reminded me all week how important my words would be, how much the congregation was counting on me to inspire and unite them. I felt the weight of both expectations pressing down—one man’s immediate need for help, and an entire community’s anticipation. My heart pounded as I realized I couldn’t possibly give both what they deserved at the same time.
